section.title: Running a Web Application in a Servlet Container
Task
section.para: You need to run a web application in a servlet container.

section.title: Action
section.para: Configure your web application's Maven project to inlcude the Maven Jetty plugin as shown in the following POM:
To start the web application in Jetty, run the run goal from the Maven Jetty plugin by running mvn jetty:run.

section.title: Detail
section.para: Consider a simple web application with a single index.jsp page that contains a form, and a single Servlet that calculates a number from the Fibonacci sequence.

example.title: Simple Form Accepting an Index to Pass to the Fibonacci Servlet

Fibonacci Page

Fetch Fibonacci Sequence Index:

section.para: The following class is the Servlet which calculates the Fibonacci sequence. It takes a single parameter index and simply prints of the number at the specified position of the Fibonacci sequence.

example.title: Fibonacci Servlet which Calculates a Number from the Fibonacci Sequence

section.para: The following web.xml configures the FibonacciServlet to respond to the request path <context>/fib.

example.title: Web Application Descriptor for sample-web
example.programlisting:
<!DOCTYPE web-app PUBLIC "-//Sun Microsystems, Inc.//DTD Web Application 2.3//EN" "http://java.sun.com/dtd/web-app_2_3.dtd" >
<web-app> <display-name>Archetype Created Web Application</display-name> <servlet> <servlet-name>fibonacci</servlet-name> <servlet-class>org.sonatype.mhandbook.FibonacciServlet</servlet-class> </servlet> <servlet-mapping> <servlet-name>fibonacci</servlet-name> <url-pattern>/fib</url-pattern> </servlet-mapping> </web-app>

section.para: After running mvn:jetty, you can load the initial form by going to http://localhost:8080/sample-web/index.jsp. Populating the form with an index and pressing calculate will load the Fibonacci servlet and print out the number at that position of the sequence.

section.title: Starting a WAR Dependency in a Servlet Container
Task
section.para: You need to configure Maven to download and start a web application from a repository manager.

section.title: Action
section.para: Use the Maven Dependency plugin to copy the web application to your project. Then configure the Maven Jetty plugin to execute the web application.
